newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA POSTS $301.8 MLN TRADE DEFICIT IN OCTOBER.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA POSTS $301.8 MLN TRADE DEFICIT IN OCTOBER.

text.p: Romania's trade balance showed a $301.8 million deficit in October, against September's $6.2 million surplus, under the impact of pre-winter imports, National Statistics Board (CNS) data showed on Monday.
Romanian exports in October amounted to $610.4 million, or 19.8 percent down from the previous month and 11.2 percent down year-on-year.
October's imports stood at $912.2 million, or 20.9 percent up from September and 13.2 percent up from last October.
The CNS said that in the first 10 months of 1996, exports fell by 6.1 percent from the year-ago period to $6.06 billion and imports were 8.5 percent down to $6.95 billion.
The 10-month trade balance posted a $890.3 million gap.
Common metals and textiles took some 36 percent of January- October exports, while minerals accounted for 25.2 percent of Romanian imports, CNS data showed.
Some 55.9 percent of 10-month exports went to European Union countries, wherefrom Romania took more than half of its imports. Germany was Romania's leading trading partner.

NOTES -- All figures in FOB prices. The CNS October import data include September oil imports for which customs documents were cleared in October but do not include oil imports for which customs papers had not been cleared by end-October. -- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
